Key Match Events: Mauritius held India goalless in Manolo Marquez's first match as head coach
India failed to score despite enjoying possession early on
Jeremy Villeneuve of Mauritius won a set-piece and unleashed the ball into the box, but Jeakson Singh made the clearance

Manvir Singh was sent through on goal by Anirudh Thapa and challenged the Mauritius goalkeeper Kevin Obrian with his left-footed strike, but the custodian was up to the task and pulled off an important save
Lallianzuala Chhangte sent the ball inside the visitors' box, but an alert Obrian was there to thwart the attempt
Sahal Abdul Samad ran down the flank but Mauritius had defenders in numbers to deny India
Mauritius came close to scoring what would have been a brilliant goal but the shot missed the target by a whisker
Pre-Game Insights: India, ranked 124th in the FIFA chart, were placed 55 spots above 174th-ranked Mauritius
The failure to make the third round of 2026 World Cup Qualifiers still fresh in memory, which led to the unceremonious exit of former coach Igor Stimac
Post-Match Reflections: The Indian defence was tested as early as the eighth minute
India showed a lot more urgency and enterprise in the second half, looking to create chances and put the visitors under pressure
Both teams continued to create the occasional chances but lacked the finishing touches, with Mauritius often looking the better team on display
Miscellaneous Highlights: India's Manolo Marquez's stint as head coach began with a goalless draw against lower-ranked Mauritius in the Intercontinental Cup opener
The game was played at the GMC Balayogi Athletic Stadium in Hyderabad
India, placed as many as 55 spots above 174th-ranked Mauritius, failed to find the back of the net and once again left their fans disappointed
